intro: Sitanion hystrix var. hordeoides, commonly known as the hordeoid bristlegrass, is a perennial grass species native to certain regions of Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, bristly leaves and compact growth habit, which help it thrive in dry and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers, typical of the Poaceae family. It is often found in disturbed soils and can be a pioneer species in ecological succession. Its botanical features make it adaptable to various soil types and climatic conditions.
